intro: Monoon longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved monoon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along streambanks. Monoon longifolium is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
